issue.title: [C++] Add more general BoundsCheck function that also checks for arbitrary lower limits in integer arrays
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-9118](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9118). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
See ARROW-9083. The current `IndexBoundsCheck` is specialized to skip a comparison for unsigned integers and uses 0 as the lower bound for signed integers. This could be generalized so that we could check e.g. if int64 values will fit in the int32 range

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9118?focusedCommentId=17137945) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
This can be used to check for integer downcast overflows faster
